They're a steady rental performer and are in a very under-serviced area with regards to rental housing. Internet Remarks: Located in one of Bowen’s established neighbourhoods, a love for design and nature are clearly evident when you step through the gate into the private and serene setting. The custom Post and Beam home, with vaulted ceilings, skylights, and massive beams is eclectic and unique, with functional and flexible spaces for everyone. Sunlight floods the main floor living, dining, kitchen, and den areas through the south facing windows with bonus filtered views of Deep Bay and the ferry. Indoor/outdoor living is at its best with more than 1000 sf of decks and patios. In the lovingly tended gardens you’ll find mature trees, shrubs, ferns, perennials, fruit trees, and sky-high rhododendrons. Birds and insects are in abundance among the beautiful ponds, complete with cattails, water lilies, and red goldfish! Guests will be comfortable in the detached suite, with private patio and parking spot. Secluded Miller’s Landing Beach is just around the corner, and the ferry and Snug Cove are just a 5 minute drive away.

Internet Remarks: At the top of a hill, and nestled among majestic Firs and Arbutus trees, lies this architectural showstopper. With its Post and Beam construction, and vaulted ceilings, it is reminiscent of those stunning Whistler vacation homes you’ve dreamed might be your own one day. The main floor south facing windows frame sweeping vistas of Howe Sound and the North Shore Mountains from every angle. Kitchen cabinetry is purposefully kept below counter height so as not to impede the views. Radiant heated Italian tile floors, and a gorgeous wood-burning fireplace, ensure your comfort in the colder months. The upper floor is dedicated to a luxurious, spa-like, 726 square foot master suite with a dramatic skylight that runs the length of the room. Where else can you stargaze from your bed and your bathtub? This listing package includes 2 vacant lots, one on either side of the main property. Your privacy is guaranteed on a total of 1.5 acres, and at the end of the road. Yet, you are still just a short drive to Snug Cove.

Public Remarks: The Sutherland Residence is a fine example of a Craftsman-style heritage home that has been brought up to today's standards. Built in 1944 for Ross Sutherland, an employee of the Thurston-Flavelle sawmill in Port Moody, it likely used local mill materials. Relocated from 2830 St. George St., this charming 4BD/3BA home is part of the City's Heritage Protection initiative.A carefully executed restoration/rehabilitation plan was completed in 2020 with new foundation and basement, roof, electrical, plumbing, heating, and kitchen.Partially finished garden level basement with 9' ceilings and separate entrance awaits your ideas.Take in Port Moody's vibrant Arts & Culture scene, Brewery District and outdoor activities.
